  "description": "Health Assur Limited is&nbsp;a leading and fast-growing healthcare and health management organization committed to delivering high-quality, accessible and sustainable healthcare solutions. Our operations span healthcare service delivery, public health management, quality assurance and health system support across multiple locations.

Driven by professionalism, innovation and integrity, we focus on improving health outcomes through strong clinical governance, data-driven decision-making and continuous quality improvement. We work with medical professionals, health institutions, government agencies and private sector partners to strengthen healthcare systems and promote public health best practices. Our organization provides a dynamic and ethical working environment where skilled professionals are encouraged to grow, innovate and make meaningful contributions to improving lives and communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Sales and Marketing

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogudu / Ojota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Head of Sales &amp; Marketing is responsible for driving revenue growth, expanding the HMO&rsquo;s market share, building strategic relationships, and positioning the organization competitively within the healthcare insurance industry.
	The role oversees corporate, retail, broker, and provider-related sales channels while ensuring compliance with NHIA guidelines and internal policies.


Key Responsibilities
Sales Strategy &amp; Revenue Growth:


	Develop and implement annual and long-term sales and marketing strategies aligned with organizational objectives.
	Drive corporate, SME, retail, and group enrolments to achieve premium income targets.
	Identify new market opportunities, partnerships, and distribution channels.
	Lead pricing and proposal development in collaboration with underwriting and finance teams.
	Monitor sales performance against targets and implement corrective actions where necessary.


Business Development &amp; Key Account Management:


	Build and manage relationships with corporate clients, brokers, HMOs&rsquo; strategic partners, and healthcare providers.
	Lead negotiations and contract renewals with corporate and group clients.
	Ensure high client retention through proactive engagement and service quality monitoring.
	Identify cross-selling and up-selling opportunities across health plans and value-added services.


Marketing &amp; Brand Management:


	Develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns (digital, field marketing, events, and partnerships).
	Strengthen brand visibility and positioning in the healthcare insurance market.
	Oversee product launches, promotions, and awareness programs.
	Collaborate with service delivery and provider management teams to align brand promise with customer experience.


Team Leadership &amp; Performance Management:


	Lead, mentor, and motivate the Sales &amp; Marketing team to achieve performance targets.
	Set KPIs, conduct performance reviews, and implement training and coaching programs.
	Build a high-performance sales culture focused on ethical selling and compliance.
	Ensure proper deployment and productivity of field sales executives.


Market Intelligence &amp; Reporting:


	Conduct market research to monitor competitor activities, pricing trends, and customer needs.
	Prepare and present sales forecasts, performance reports, and market insights to executive management.
	Use data to inform strategic decisions and improve sales effectiveness.


Compliance &amp; Stakeholder Collaboration:


	Ensure all sales and marketing activities comply with NHIA regulations, internal policies, and ethical standards.
	Work closely with Claims, Provider Management, Underwriting, Finance, and IT departments to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Support audits and regulatory reviews as required.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Premium income growth
	New client acquisition
	Client retention rate
	Market share expansion
	Sales team productivity
	Brand visibility and campaign effectiveness


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Insurance, Economics, or a related field.
	A Master&rsquo;s degree (MBA or related) is a pre requisite.
	Relevant professional certifications in Marketing, Insurance, or Sales are desirable.


Required Experience:


	8&ndash;12 years of progressive experience in sales and marketing, preferably within:
	
		Health Maintenance Organizations (HMO)
		Health Insurance
		Insurance or Financial Services
	
	
	Minimum of 3&ndash;5 years in a senior leadership or managerial role.
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
	Strong experience in corporate sales, broker management, and healthcare market dynamics.
	Demonstrated ability to lead and manage high-performing teams.


Key Competencies &amp; Skills:


	Strategic thinking and business acumen
	Strong negotiation and relationship-management skills
	Deep understanding of the Nigerian healthcare insurance landscape
	Leadership and people management skills
	Excellent communication and presentation abilities
	Analytical and reporting skills
	Ethical judgment and regulatory awareness.


Salary
N600,000 - N800,000 per month.

Head of Sales and Marketing Job at Health Assur Limited




        
    

        
        Health Assur Limited is a leading and fast-growing healthcare and health management organization committed to delivering high-quality, accessible and sustainable healthcare solutions. Our operations span healthcare service delivery, public health management, quality assurance and health system support across multiple locations.
     

            
    



Driven by professionalism, innovation and integrity, we focus on improving health outcomes through strong clinical governance, data-driven decision-making and continuous quality improvement. We work with medical professionals, health institutions, government agencies and private sector partners to strengthen healthcare systems and promote public health best practices. Our organization provides a dynamic and ethical working environment where skilled professionals are encouraged to grow, innovate and make meaningful contributions to improving lives and communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Sales and Marketing

Job Location: Ogudu / Ojota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Head of Sales & Marketing is responsible for driving revenue growth, expanding the HMO’s market share, building strategic relationships, and positioning the organization competitively within the healthcare insurance industry.
	The role oversees corporate, retail, broker, and provider-related sales channels while ensuring compliance with NHIA guidelines and internal policies.


Key Responsibilities
Sales Strategy & Revenue Growth:


	Develop and implement annual and long-term sales and marketing strategies aligned with organizational objectives.
	Drive corporate, SME, retail, and group enrolments to achieve premium income targets.
	Identify new market opportunities, partnerships, and distribution channels.
	Lead pricing and proposal development in collaboration with underwriting and finance teams.
	Monitor sales performance against targets and implement corrective actions where necessary.


Business Development & Key Account Management:


	Build and manage relationships with corporate clients, brokers, HMOs’ strategic partners, and healthcare providers.
	Lead negotiations and contract renewals with corporate and group clients.
	Ensure high client retention through proactive engagement and service quality monitoring.
	Identify cross-selling and up-selling opportunities across health plans and value-added services.


Marketing & Brand Management:


	Develop and execute integrated marketing campaigns (digital, field marketing, events, and partnerships).
	Strengthen brand visibility and positioning in the healthcare insurance market.
	Oversee product launches, promotions, and awareness programs.
	Collaborate with service delivery and provider management teams to align brand promise with customer experience.


Team Leadership & Performance Management:


	Lead, mentor, and motivate the Sales & Marketing team to achieve performance targets.
	Set KPIs, conduct performance reviews, and implement training and coaching programs.
	Build a high-performance sales culture focused on ethical selling and compliance.
	Ensure proper deployment and productivity of field sales executives.


Market Intelligence & Reporting:


	Conduct market research to monitor competitor activities, pricing trends, and customer needs.
	Prepare and present sales forecasts, performance reports, and market insights to executive management.
	Use data to inform strategic decisions and improve sales effectiveness.


Compliance & Stakeholder Collaboration:


	Ensure all sales and marketing activities comply with NHIA regulations, internal policies, and ethical standards.
	Work closely with Claims, Provider Management, Underwriting, Finance, and IT departments to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Support audits and regulatory reviews as required.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Premium income growth
	New client acquisition
	Client retention rate
	Market share expansion
	Sales team productivity
	Brand visibility and campaign effectiveness


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Insurance, Economics, or a related field.
	A Master’s degree (MBA or related) is a pre requisite.
	Relevant professional certifications in Marketing, Insurance, or Sales are desirable.


Required Experience:


	8–12 years of progressive experience in sales and marketing, preferably within:
	
		Health Maintenance Organizations (HMO)
		Health Insurance
		Insurance or Financial Services
	
	
	Minimum of 3–5 years in a senior leadership or managerial role.
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
	Strong experience in corporate sales, broker management, and healthcare market dynamics.
	Demonstrated ability to lead and manage high-performing teams.


Key Competencies & Skills:


	Strategic thinking and business acumen
	Strong negotiation and relationship-management skills
	Deep understanding of the Nigerian healthcare insurance landscape
	Leadership and people management skills
	Excellent communication and presentation abilities
	Analytical and reporting skills
	Ethical judgment and regulatory awareness.


Salary
N600,000 - N800,000 per month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@healthassur.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Vacancies at UMERA Farms Limited
content:
UMERA Farms Limited is an Agro-allied company, registered in Nigeria under the Companies and Allied Matters Act 1990 of the Corporate Affairs Commission on the 18th August, 2020. UMERA Farms operate in the diversified agribusiness; livestock and crop farming production, with our primary focus on cashew crop production.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Director of Academic Affairs

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Part-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a visionary and experienced academic leader to serve as Director of Academic Affairs, providing strategic leadership for all academic activities of the school.
	The Director of Academic Affairs will oversee the planning, development, delivery, and continuous improvement of all academic programs at Umera Business School.
	The role requires strong leadership, academic excellence, curriculum development expertise, and the ability to align academic standards with industry relevance and institutional goals.


Key Responsibilties
Academic Leadership & Strategy:


	Provide strategic leadership for all academic programs, ensuring alignment with the school’s mission and vision.
	Develop and implement academic policies, standards, and procedures in line with best practices.
	Drive innovation in teaching, learning, and assessment methodologies.


Curriculum Development & Quality Assurance:


	Oversee the design, review, and accreditation of academic and executive education programs.
	Ensure curriculum relevance, rigor, and compliance with regulatory and accreditation requirements.
	Monitor and continuously improve academic quality and learning outcomes.


Faculty & Instructional Oversight:


	Recruit, mentor, evaluate, and support faculty members and adjunct instructors.
	Promote faculty development, research, and instructional excellence.
	Ensure effective course delivery and adherence to academic schedules.


Student Academic Affairs:


	Oversee academic advising, assessment, grading standards, and academic progression.
	Address academic concerns, grievances, and disciplinary matters fairly and professionally.
	Support student success initiatives and learning support systems.


Institutional Collaboration & Representation:


	Work closely with the Managing Director, administrative teams, and external partners.
	Represent the school in academic partnerships, accreditation engagements, and academic events.
	Support the development of industry-aligned programs and executive training offerings.


Reporting & Administration:


	Prepare academic reports, program evaluations, and performance metrics.
	Manage academic budgets, resources, and schedules efficiently.
	Ensure accurate academic records and documentation.


Qualifications and Experience


	
	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree with proven experience in curriculum development, academic administration, or program management.
	


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong leadership, organizational, and decision-making skills.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal abilities.
	Deep understanding of academic quality assurance and accreditation processes.
	Ability to balance academic integrity with practical, industry-focused learning.
	High level of professionalism, integrity, and strategic thinking.


Application Closing Date: 31st January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief introduction to: lanreoladipo@umera.ng using "Application – Sales Manager OR Application – Realtor" as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, WhatsApp only to 08029008225.

 

 

2.) Director, Grants & Strategic Partnership Manager

Job Location: Ibadan, Ogbomoso - Oyo (Hybrid with travel)
Employment Type: Full-Time (Senior Level)
Sector: Agriculture • Rural Development • Impact • Youth

Key Responsibilities


	Design and scale multi-year programs focused on youth and women agribusiness enterprise development.
	Lead grant sourcing, proposal development, fundraising strategy, and donor negotiations.
	Build and manage relationships with international development partners (Mastercard Foundation, AfDB, USAID, Afreximbank, UN agencies, philanthropic foundations, banks,
	etc.)
	Develop impact frameworks, KPls, budgets, Theory of Change, and M&E systems.
	Coordinate program pilots and implementation with UMéRA Farms, UMéRA Business School, and Alaafia Village.
	Prepare donor reports, impact documentation, and annual impact publications.
	Represent UMéRA at high-level conferences, donor meetings, and government engagements.
	Structure blended finance and co-funding models, including diaspora-supported investment pathways.
	Develop sustainability and scale strategies (Oyo Southwest -4 National).


Ideal Candidate Profile


	7-12+ years of experience in international development, agriculture programs, donor-funded projects, rural development, impact investing, public-private partnerships, or related fields.
	Proven experience raising or managing grants of $1 M+ from institutional funders.
	Strong technical writing, proposal development, and research capability.
	Excellent stakeholder relationship management and communication skills.
	Experience working with youth/women empowerment, food systems, climate, or rural development programs (strong advantage).
	Familiarity with African agricultural ecosystems is preferred. Advanced degree in development, agriculture, economics, public policy, business, or related disciplines is a plus. Entrepreneurial attitude, mission-driven, and comfortable building systems from the ground up.


What We Offer


	Opportunity to shape a landmark rural transformation model in Africa.
	High-impact leadership role with global visibility. Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives.
	Multi-stakeholder exposure (development, government, private sector, diaspora).
	Values-based organization with strong vision and execution capacity.


Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV/Resume, Cover Letter (1 page) OR Project Portfolio demonstrating relevant experience to: lanreoladipo@umera.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquires, WhatsApp only to 08029008225.

 

3.) Real Estate Sales Manager

Job Location:  Lagos

Job Description


	The Sales Manager will lead thesales team and drive revenue growth through structured sales strategies for our agro-tourism land project.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement sales strategies for agro-tourism land sales, Recruit, train, and supervise realtors and sales executives, Set sales targets and monitor individual and team performance, Coordinate site inspections and client investment tours, Build and maintain strong relationships with investors and partners, Prepare weekly and monthly sales performance reports, Collaborate with management on marketing and promotional campaigns


Requirements


	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in real estate sales (land sales preferred)
	Proven leadership and team management skills
	Strong knowledge of Lagos real estate market
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and closing skills
	Must be based in Lagos
	Experience selling investment or estate lands is a strong advantage.
	Experience in real estate sales is an advantage (fresh but trainable candidates may apply)
	Strong persuasion and customer-relation skills
	Self-motivated and target-driven,
	Ability to work independently and within a team.


Application Closing Date: 30th January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief introduction to: lanreoladipo@umera.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more information, via WhatsApp numbder: 08029008225

  "title": "End User Support / IT Support Officer",
  "description": "Trigus Solutions Limited is a Lagos-based leader in managed IT services, technology consulting, IT outsourced staffing and digital online solutions, dedicated to providing businesses with scalable, innovative systems. Our mission is to empower businesses, both large and small, with innovative technology solutions that drive growth, efficiency, and success.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;End User Support / IT Support Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract
Reports to: Technical Specialist
Department: IT

Job Description


	The IT Officer will provide technical support, maintain IT infrastructure, and ensure smooth dailyoperations of hardware, software, and network systems at a client site in Lekki, Lagos Nigeria.
	This role is responsible for troubleshooting issues,assisting users, and supporting the implementation of IT projects.
	The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented, proactive, and have hands-on experience in system administration, user support, and IT securitypractices.


Job Summary
Technical Support and User Assistance:


	Provide first-line support for hardware, software, and network issues.
	Troubleshoot and resolve system errors, connectivity problems, and user complaints.
	Set up user accounts, emails, and IT access permissions.


Systems and Network Administration:


	Assist in the installation, configuration, and maintenance of IT systems and networks.
	Monitor servers, routers, switches, and firewalls to ensure smooth operations.
	Support data backup, recovery, and storage management processes.


Hardware and Software Management:


	Install, configure, and maintain computers, printers, mobile devices, and software applications.
	Ensure timely updates, upgrades, and patches for systems and applications.
	Maintain IT asset inventory and records.


Security and Compliance:


	Enforce IT security protocols, including password policies, antivirus, and firewalls.
	Report and respond to security incidents or breaches.
	Ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory IT standards.


Project and Innovation Support:


	Support the IT Manager in implementing new technologies, systems, and projects.
	Research and recommend tools and solutions to improve efficiency.
	Assist with digital transformation initiatives within the organization.


Documentation and Reporting:


	Maintain accurate documentation of IT systems, user issues, and solutions.
	Prepare periodic reports on IT performance, system uptime, and support cases.


Nice-to-Haves


	Certifications: CCNA, Comptia A+, Comptia Security+, any foundational Cloud
	Working knowledge of the Microsoft 365, Microsoft Power platform and general workflow automation
	Experience working in a corporate environment.

End User Support / IT Support Officer Job at Trigus Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        Trigus Solutions Limited is a Lagos-based leader in managed IT services, technology consulting, IT outsourced staffing and digital online solutions, dedicated to providing businesses with scalable, innovative systems. Our mission is to empower businesses, both large and small, with innovative technology solutions that drive growth, efficiency, and success.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: End User Support / IT Support Officer

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Contract
Reports to: Technical Specialist
Department: IT

Job Description
     

            
    




	The IT Officer will provide technical support, maintain IT infrastructure, and ensure smooth dailyoperations of hardware, software, and network systems at a client site in Lekki, Lagos Nigeria.
	This role is responsible for troubleshooting issues,assisting users, and supporting the implementation of IT projects.
	The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented, proactive, and have hands-on experience in system administration, user support, and IT securitypractices.


Job Summary
Technical Support and User Assistance:


	Provide first-line support for hardware, software, and network issues.
	Troubleshoot and resolve system errors, connectivity problems, and user complaints.
	Set up user accounts, emails, and IT access permissions.


Systems and Network Administration:


	Assist in the installation, configuration, and maintenance of IT systems and networks.
	Monitor servers, routers, switches, and firewalls to ensure smooth operations.
	Support data backup, recovery, and storage management processes.


Hardware and Software Management:


	Install, configure, and maintain computers, printers, mobile devices, and software applications.
	Ensure timely updates, upgrades, and patches for systems and applications.
	Maintain IT asset inventory and records.


Security and Compliance:


	Enforce IT security protocols, including password policies, antivirus, and firewalls.
	Report and respond to security incidents or breaches.
	Ensure compliance with organizational and regulatory IT standards.


Project and Innovation Support:


	Support the IT Manager in implementing new technologies, systems, and projects.
	Research and recommend tools and solutions to improve efficiency.
	Assist with digital transformation initiatives within the organization.


Documentation and Reporting:


	Maintain accurate documentation of IT systems, user issues, and solutions.
	Prepare periodic reports on IT performance, system uptime, and support cases.


Nice-to-Haves


	Certifications: CCNA, Comptia A+, Comptia Security+, any foundational Cloud
	Working knowledge of the Microsoft 365, Microsoft Power platform and general workflow automation
	Experience working in a corporate environment.


Compensation & Benefits


	Pay: N300,000 - N350,000 / month.
	Employees will receive a competitive salary based on their role and experience.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: info@trigus-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Cashier Job at Chilis Restaurant




        
    

        
        Chilis Restaurant is a 24-hours restaurant with good quality of food and good services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier
Job Location: Bodija, Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Transaction Handling: Process payments from customers using various payment methods such as cash, debit cards, and mobile/ transfer payments and issuing change accurately
	Order Management: Take customer orders and input them into the point of sale (POS) system accurately. Also ensure that any special requests or modifications are clearly communicated to the kitchen staff.
	Customer service: Greet customers warmly and answer any questions about the menu or promotions. Also address customer complaints or issues promptly and professionally to ensure satisfaction.
	Cash Drawer Management: Count Money in the cash drawer at the beginning and end of shifts to ensure accuracy. Maintain adequate change in the cash drawer and reconcile daily cash receipts with sales., including sanitizing
	Cleaning and Maintenance: Keep the cashier area clean and organize, including sanitizing surfaces and organizing receipts, documents and all cashiers books. Also ensure that the work area is tidy and free of clutter.
	Inventory and Supplies: Monitor supplies in the cashier area, such as receipt paper and condiments. Also notify management when stock is low and needs replenishing.
	Speed and Efficiency: Work quickly and efficiently to minimize wait times for customers
	It's a 24hrs restaurant that runs morning, afternoon and night shifts.
	Proximity to Awolowo is preferred.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 2 - 5 years of experience.


Salary
N40,000 - N45,000 / month

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chilisrestaurant.ibadan@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
